src.TrackingDataLoader module¶

class src.TrackingDataLoader.TrackingDataLoader(variable: str, path: str, start_date: datetime | None = None, end_date: datetime | None = None, suffix: str = '', file_type: str = 'nc')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that loads and prepares input data for the MOAAP Tracking algorithm. Currently loads data in chunks of 7 months. (from January to August and from July to February respectively) Assumes that the input data are fiven in files that contain yearly data of the form:

{path}/{variable}/{variable}_{year}010100-{year}23123_{suffix}{file_type}, so for instance {path}/IVTu/IVTu_1986010100-1986123123_remapped_3x.nc

If the dates of a data chunk range from 1.1-1.8, one single input file is simply loaded and the dates properly selected. As chunks with date ranging from 1.7-1.2 require data from two consecutive years, two yearly input files are first merged and accordingly the dates afterwards properly selected.

property end_date: datetime¶

End date of data chunk

Raises:

AttributeError – end_date has to be explicitly set.

property filename_merged¶

Get file name of merged netcdf file (only if date 1.7-1.2)

property filename_year1¶

Get filename of the first year.

property filename_year2¶

Get filename of the second year. Same as filename_year2 for date range (1.1-1.8)

load_datasets(rm_nc=True) → Dataset[source]¶

Load

Parameters:

rm_nc (bool, optional) – Remove merged netCDF4 files finally. Defaults to True.

Returns:

Dataset containing the input data for the Tracking algorithm, selected according to the specified data range

Return type:

xr.Dataset

merge_ncfiles()[source]¶

Set Start date of Tracking data chunk

Raises:

AttributeError – end_date has to be explicitly set.

property year_end¶

Get end year of data chunk

Get start year of data chunk

src.Tracking_Functions module¶

Tracking_Functions.py

This file contains the tracking fuctions for the object identification and tracking of precipitation areas, cyclones, clouds, and moisture streams

src.Tracking_Functions.BreakupObjects(DATA, min_tsteps, dT, obj_history=False)[source]¶
src.Tracking_Functions.ConnectLon(object_indices)[source]¶
src.Tracking_Functions.ConnectLon_on_timestep(object_indices)[source]¶

This function connects objects over the date line on a time-step by time-step basis, which makes it different from the ConnectLon function. This function is needed when long-living objects are first split into smaller objects using the BreakupObjects function.

src.Tracking_Functions.calc_grid_distance_area(lon, lat)[source]¶

Function to calculate grid parameters It uses haversine function to approximate distances It approximates the first row and column to the sencond because coordinates of grid cell center are assumed lat, lon: input coordinates(degrees) 2D [y,x] dimensions dx: distance (m) dy: distance (m) area: area of grid cell (m2) grid_distance: average grid distance over the domain (m)

src.Tracking_Functions.detect_local_minima(arr)[source]¶

Takes an array and detects the troughs using the local maximum filter. Returns a boolean mask of the troughs (i.e. 1 when the pixel’s value is the neighborhood maximum, 0 otherwise)

src.Tracking_Functions.remove_small_short_objects(objects_id, area_objects, min_area, min_time, DT, objects=None)[source]¶

Checks if the object is large enough during enough time steps and removes objects that do not meet this condition area_object: array of lists with areas of each objects during their lifetime [objects[tsteps]] min_area: minimum area of the object (km2) min_time: minimum time with the object large enough (hours) DT: time step of input data [hours] objects: object slices - speeds up processing if provided

src.Tracking_Functions.smooth_uniform(data, t_smoot, xy_smooth)[source]¶

Function to spatiotemporal smooth atmospheric fiels even if they contain missing data

src.Tracking_Functions.timer(start, end)[source]¶
src.Tracking_Functions.track_tropwaves(pr, Lat, connectLon, dT)[source]¶

Identifies and tracks four types of tropical waves from hourly precipitation data: Mixed Rossby Gravity Waves n>=0 Eastward Inertio Gravirt Wave Kelvin Waves and n>=1 Inertio Gravirt Wave

src.plot_funcs module¶

src.plot_funcs.plot_unstructured_rotated_grid(lon, lat, z, index, fig, levels=[1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 20, 25, 30], subplts=(4, 1), pad=0.01, title='', cbar_label=None, cmap='Blues')[source]¶

Plot data field over the regional ICON domain using rotated coordinates. Functions uses tricontourf, so it requires (unordered) 1-D arrays as input.

Parameters:

  • lon (ArrayLike) – 1-D array of size N with longitudes

  • lat (ArrayLike) – 1-D array of size N with latitudes

  • z (ArrayLike) – 1-D array of size N

  • fig – Figure instance

  • levels (int or array-like) – Number and position of contour lines. Default to [1, 2, 3, 5,7,9,12,15,20,25,30].

  • subplts (tuple) – number/shape of subplots. Default to (4,1).

  • pad (float) – padding to align the colorbar

  • index (int) – index for subplots.

  • title (bool, optional) – Set title. Defaults to None.

  • cbar_label (bool, optional) – Add colorbar. Defaults to ‘’.

  • cmap (str,optional) –

class src.xarray_util.ObjectContainer(iterable)[source]¶

Bases: list

Custom list-like class, which elements are xr.dataset objects and contain information about different Tracking Objects. Implements custom methods to conveniently access and compute statistics of attributes of Tracking objects.

append(item) → None[source]¶

Append Tracking

Parameters:

item (xr.Dataset) – Tracking Object to append

Raises:

TypeError – If appended Tracking object is not a xr.Dataset

count() → int[source]¶
Returns:

Number of Tracking objects in Container

Return type:

int

filter_by_median(threshold, attr, above=True) → ObjectContainer[source]¶

Select only those Tracking Objects in Container which attributes’ median value are below/above a certain threshold

Parameters:

  • threshold (float) – Treshold value

  • attr (str) – Attribute name

  • above (bool, optional) – Select only objects with attriubte median value above threshold. Defaults to True.

Returns:

Selected Tracking objects

Return type:

Object_container

Create Tracking object xr.Dataset from Dictionary
